definition: to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
to put down weapon and let soldiers rest (idiom); to relax from fighting

sentences.english: After several rounds of negotiation, the two countries finally agreed on a cease-fire.
sentences.chinese: 经过几轮谈判，两国终于休兵停战。

sentences.english: Neighbors who were at war would call a truce to participate in the games.
sentences.chinese: 那些在战争中的邻国都会号召暂时休兵以参加运动会。

sentences.english: Mr Ma has also called from the outset for a "diplomatic truce".
sentences.chinese: 马英九还要求从“外交休兵”开始。

sentences.english: To Beijing, this constitutes another form of diplomatic truce.
sentences.chinese: 对中国，这是另一层意义的外交休兵。

sentences.english: By and by the tempest spent itself and died without accomplishing its object.
sentences.chinese: 15后来，暴风雨精疲力尽，未达目的即告休兵。

sentences.english: When will the two countries cease fire?
sentences.chinese: 这两个国家何时会休兵？

definition: to retreat/to withdraw troops/to recall troops/fig. to finish work/to wind up/to call it a day/used with negatives: the task is far from over
to beat the gong to recall troops (idiom); to order a retreat
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to withdraw troops from the front/to return in triumph
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
